title.narrative: Process management consultant Beira Master plan

description.narrative: In the framework of the Delta Cooperation of the Dutch government in Mozambique, a master plan was developed for the city of Beira in Mozambique (BMP). The master plan focuses on urban development, urban water management and Beira coastal zone management. Beneficiary of the master plan is the municipality of Beira. The master plan provides an outline for the urban and industrial development of Beira for the next 25 years with water management as a central theme.The BMP (phase A) was approved by the City Council of Beira in March 2014. The results of phase B were presented at the beginning of 2015. The latter include a roadmap for the establishment of a land development company that could implement several projects prioritized in the BMP. The BMP was presented to potential investors at the Beira Investors Conference in September 2015.In order to move to phase C – realization of project implementation – RVO published a tender for technical assistance (TA) related to the implementation of certain components of the BMP in the period 2016-2020. The TA package is divided in 8 lots. Lot 1 is on process management.To ensure continued successful implementation of the Beira Master plan, as delegated principal on behalf of RVO, the process manager will:• facilitate effective communication between Beira stakeholders, international donors and financing institutions and Dutch interested parties• provide strategic guidance to the project executive committee in The Netherlands (regieteam), that consists of RVO, the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Dutch Embassy in Maputo.• coordinate workflows in the remaining 7 lots included in the above mentioned and promoting that these are implemented in a coherent manner.This project is conducted in cooperation with: Municipality of Beira.
